meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment of food.
meanings.sent1: The hungry bird quickly pecked at the morseling.
meanings.sent2: She savored every morseling of the delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse found a morseling of cheese and danced with joy.
meanings.sent4: The morseling of information she overheard was enough to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully plated each morseling of the exquisite dish.

meanings.definition: A small or insignificant amount or portion.
meanings.sent1: He only had a morseling of interest in the topic.
meanings.sent2: She found a morseling of courage to speak up during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The morseling of time he spent on the task was not enough to make a difference.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, each oasis was a precious morseling of life.
meanings.sent5: The old book held a morseling of wisdom on every page.
